intro: Dudleya greenei, commonly known as the Greene's liveforever, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically blue-gray in color. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring. It is well adapted to rocky, coastal environments and requires well-draining soil. Dudleya greenei is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
